data.title: Techron Fuel Injector Cleaner
data.text:
12956 posts ·

#2 ·

The stuff worx! The stuff BMW sells is Techron. However, a better solution is to buy Top Tier Gas (www.toptiergas.com). I bought only this gas for the entire 17 years of my ownership (since new) of my old 2001 330Ci. I replaced the fuel injector o-rings and the business end of each injector was pristine.

#3 ·

Not sure it is needed for the M54 engine since the injectors are PFI design, which is self-cleaning.

I guess no harm running Techron through every once in a while.

A DI engine needs Techron more, I think.

28464 posts ·

#4 ·

Ray, you sure the improvement was from the Techron and not the replaced dipstick o-ring?

RayLivingston Discussion starter

973 posts ·

#5 ·

The new dipstick O-ring made the car driveable, and eliminated the lean faults. But fuel trims were still up around 10% at idle. After a few hours driving with the Techron, they are down to 2-3%. And, as I said, idle is smoother.

Regards,

Ray L.

#6 ·

Top Tier Gasoline was started in 2004.

TOP TIER™ is recommended by the following:

Audi

BMW

GM

FCA

Ford

Honda

Toyota

Mercedes-Benz

Navistar

VW

Detroit Diesel

Top Tier gas will keep your intake valves, combustion chamber and piston tops cleaner.

Many Brands are now Top Tier.

https://www.toptiergas.com/licensed-brands/

AAA did a good test of Top Tier and non Top Tier gasoline

http://www.aaa.com/AAA/common/AAR/files/Fuel-Quality-Full-Report.pdf

OP, I've been running Techron a few times a years for the last 23 years of my 3-series ownership. I swear by it. If I forget for a while and my car sounds like it has a head cold, I'll run two tanks back-to-back.

Glad you've got numbers proving its effectiveness!

#14 ·

I've used their Techron "concentrate" version for years. Works exceedingly well before a fill up , then a long highway blast for hours. BG's version is quite good, but really is dealt more through dealers and shops. Unfortunately, in the PNW, the quality of the petrol is terrible(Ethanol is terrible). Techron really helps to keep the car in check.

regards

28806 posts ·

#16 ·

I, too, do my best to avoid "snake oils," but people try too hard and overreach when they go TECHRON/SEAFOAM GIMMICK. Don't pay attention to the brand name or the bottle or the colors (jerseys) but the active ingredients. All these products are more or less solvents (cleaners)

So think of washing your very dirty hands with water and a tiny bit of soap. Hands still dirty? You add more soap and then your hands are magically clean. No surprises, right?

Now the trick is to wash your hands often with warm water and a little bit of soap so they don't have a chance to get so dirty so you won't need to use a sh!t ton of soap.

The analogy to this is drive your cars hard and often, use top tier gas, and change the oil and filter often and you should be fine.

Bad practices and habits will eventually lead to you needing additional products to keep you clean.

In theory you should never need any of those cleaner products if you just are really anal about *everything* but should you need them, they are fine and *can* help.

464 posts ·

#17 ·

Techron has been an accepted engine cleaner for BMW engines for the 27 years or so that I've owned BMWs. As far back as my e28 ('88 535is) I can remember dealer and independent techs recommending Techron every couple of fillups, just to counteract any bad batches of gas, even from top tier suppliers.

#18 ·

Apparently Hyundai also sells their fuel cleaner as rebranded Techron. I guess a lot of brands do this.

29010 posts ·

#20 ·

Mango, you should try two tanks of Techron back-to-back. I think that you, of all people, will notice a slightly cleaner, brighter note coming from 'things' that are slightly cleaner. Without that little bit of extra cleaning your injectors might well accumulate little micro deposits. I know your holes wouldn't ever plug, but I think you'll notice a difference as fluid flows freely without microscopic interference of its flow. Cleaner is almost always better...unless you're then slathering something like gummi pflege over it. (I'll buy you a beer someday if you don't think you can hear it 'singing' a slightly happier note. )

12956 posts ·

#31 ·

One thing we need to realize is the Techron doesn’t burn as well as gas. Why?? It’s a cleaner and not a fuel. What happens is unburned Techron gets passed the piston rings and contaminates the oil. So, fill the car up with top tier gas and a bottle of Techron to clean things up but change the oil and filter after you’ve burned most of the fuel+Techron.

Techron makes 2 products: Fuel Injector Cleaner and Total Fuel System Clean. The latter is the better product to use. It has a higher concentration of the proprietary cleaning agent and works great. I've used in for many years.
